column1: Task
Accompany patients to and from wards for medical and dental treatments, shopping trips, and religious and recreational events.
Administer active and passive manual therapeutic exercises, therapeutic massage, and heat, light, sound, water, and electrical modality treatments, such as ultrasound.
Administer bedside and personal care, such as ambulation and personal hygiene assistance.
Administer bedside or personal care, such as ambulation or personal hygiene assistance.
Administer manual exercises, massage and/or traction to help relieve pain, increase the patient's strength, and decrease or prevent deformity and crippling.
Administer manual exercises, massage or traction to help relieve pain, increase patient strength, or decrease or prevent deformity or crippling.
Administer manual exercises, massage, or traction to help relieve pain, increase patient strength, or decrease or prevent deformity or crippling.
Aid patients in dressing and grooming themselves.
Aid patients in performing tasks such as bathing and keeping beds, clothing and living areas clean.
Allocate equipment to participants in sporting events or recreational activities.
Apply moxibustion directly or indirectly to patients using Chinese, non-scarring, stick, or pole moxa.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Arrange for mating of stallions and mares, and assist mares during foaling.
Arrange for the replacement of defective fire fighting equipment and for repair of fire alarm and sprinkler systems, making minor repairs such as servicing fire extinguishers when feasible.
Assess the condition of clients' hands, remove dead skin from the hands and massage them.
Assess the condition of clients' hands, remove dead skin, and massage hands.
Assist cooks and kitchen staff with various tasks as needed, and provide cooks with needed items.
Assist hospital staff with patient care duties such as providing transportation and setting up traction.
Assist in delivery, care, and feeding of infants.
Assist in preparing food for children and serve meals and refreshments to children and regulate rest periods.
Assist in the preparation of book displays.
Assist other restaurant workers by serving food and beverages, or by bussing tables.
Assist patients to dress, undress, and put on and remove supportive devices, such as braces, splints, and slings.
Assist patrons in finding seats, lighting the way with flashlights if necessary.
Assist pipefitters in the layout, assembly, and installation of piping for air, ammonia, gas, and water systems.
Bathe animals, clip nails or claws, and brush and cut animals' hair.
Bring wine selections to tables with appropriate glasses, and pour the wines for customers.
Care for and treat women during prenatal, natal and post-natal periods.
Care for children and/or elderly persons by overseeing their activities, providing companionship, and assisting them with dressing, bathing, eating, and other needs.
Cleanse clients' skin with water, creams and/or lotions.
Close caskets and lead funeral corteges to churches or burial sites.
Collaborate with other firefighters as a member of a firefighting crew.
Complete orders from steam tables, placing food on plates and serving customers at tables or counters.
Coordinate and supervise work of kitchen staff.
Coordinate the selection and movement of logs from storage areas, according to transportation schedules or production requirements.
Cut and trim hair according to clients' instructions and/or current hairstyles, using clippers, combs, hand-held blow driers, and scissors.
Cut and trim hair according to clients' instructions or current hairstyles, using clippers, combs, hand-held blow driers, and scissors.
Cut, trim and shape hair or hairpieces, based on customers' instructions, hair type and facial features, using clippers, scissors, trimmers and razors.
Deliver equipment to specified hospital locations or to patients' residences.
Deliver medications and pharmaceutical supplies to patients, nursing stations or surgery.
Deliver messages and items, such as newspapers, documents, and packages, between establishment departments, and to other establishments and private homes.
Deliver messages and room service orders, and run errands for guests.
Deliver messages and run errands.
Deliver or direct delivery of subpoenas to witnesses and parties to action.
Deliver orders to kitchens, and pick up and serve food when it is ready.
Deliver television sets, ironing boards, baby cribs, and rollaway beds to guests' rooms.
Demonstrate use and care of equipment for tenant use.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Direct activities of staff performing repairs and maintenance to equipment, vehicles, and facilities.
Direct activities of workers who perform duties such as landscaping, cultivating lawns, or pruning trees and shrubs.
Direct activities of workers who perform duties, such as landscaping, cultivating lawns, or pruning trees and shrubs.
Direct and/or assist other workers in treatment and extermination processes to eliminate and control rodents, insects, and weeds.
Direct delivery trucks to shipping doors or designated marshalling areas, and help load and unload goods safely.
Direct or assist workers engaged in the maintenance or repair of equipment, such as power tools or motorized equipment.
Direct or monitor other workers producing chemical products.
Direct or participate in cargo loading in order to ensure completeness of load and even distribution of weight.
Direct patients in simple prescribed exercises and in the use of braces or artificial limbs.
Direct patients in simple prescribed exercises or in the use of braces or artificial limbs.
Direct the casting of the concrete and supervise laborers who use shovels or special tools to spread it.
Distribute food to servers.
Distribute food to waiters and waitresses to serve to customers.
Distribute menus to hospital patients, collect diet sheets, and deliver food trays and snacks to nursing units or directly to patients.
Drape and pin protective cloths around customers' shoulders.
Dress children and change diapers.
Drive ambulances or assist ambulance drivers in transporting sick, injured, or convalescent persons.
Drive gasoline, diesel, or electrically powered multi-passenger vehicles to transport students between neighborhoods, schools, and school activities.
Drive passenger vehicles and trucks used to transport inmates to other institutions, courtrooms, hospitals, and work sites.
Drive vehicles to visit customers, return merchandise to creditors, or deliver bills.
Examine and clean patients' ear canals.
Extend nails using powder, solvent, and paper forms attached to tips of customers' fingers to support and shape artificial nails.
Fasten safety devices for patrons, or provide them with directions for fastening devices.
Fit and dispense assistive devices, such as hearing aids.
Fit dental appliances in patients' mouths in order to alter the position and relationship of teeth and jaws, and to realign teeth.
Fit patients for orthopedic braces, prostheses, and supportive devices, adjusting fit as needed.
Fit patients for orthopedic braces, prostheses, and supportive devices, such as crutches.
Give facials to patrons, using special compounds such as lotions and creams.
Give manicures and pedicures, and apply artificial nails.
Guard facility entrances to screen visitors.
Hand instruments and supplies to surgeons and surgeons' assistants, hold retractors and cut sutures, and perform other tasks as directed by surgeon during operation.
Heat, shape, or bend plastic or metal frames in order to adjust eyeglasses to fit clients, using pliers and hands.
Help customers try on or fit merchandise.
Help patients with bathing, dressing, maintaining personal hygiene, moving in bed, or standing and walking.
Help patients with bathing, dressing, personal hygiene, moving in bed, and standing and walking.
Hold or restrain animals during veterinary procedures.
Instruct, motivate, safeguard and assist patients practicing exercises and functional activities, under direction of medical staff.
Interview patients to obtain medical information and measure their vital signs, weight, and height.
Issue gym clothes, uniforms, towels, athletic equipment, and special athletic apparel.
Lead stretching exercises for team members prior to games and practices.
Load peripheral equipment with selected materials for operating runs, or oversee loading of peripheral equipment by peripheral equipment operators.
Manage and maintain temporary or permanent lodging facilities.
Manage informational kiosk and display of event signs and posters.
Manage the movement of goods into and out of production facilities.
Massage and treat scalp for hygienic and remedial purposes, using hands, fingers, or vibrating equipment.
Massage patients and apply preparations and treatments, such as liniment, alcohol rubs, and heat-lamp stimulation.
Measure, fit, and groom hairpieces.
Mix ingredients, such as liquor, soda, water, sugar, and bitters, in order to prepare cocktails and other drinks.
Mix mortar and plaster to desired consistency or direct workers who perform mixing.
Monitor food preparation methods, portion sizes, and garnishing and presentation of food in order to ensure that food is prepared and presented in an acceptable manner.
Monitor patients' blood pressure and heart rate using electrocardiogram (EKG) equipment during diagnostic and therapeutic procedures in order to notify the physician if something appears wrong.
Monitor patients' blood pressure and heart rate using electrocardiogram (EKG) equipment during diagnostic and therapeutic procedures to notify the physician if something appears wrong.
Operate refreshment stands during intermission or obtain refreshments for press box patrons during performances.
Oversee the maintenance and repair of machinery, equipment, and electrical and mechanical systems.
Oversee the preparation and care of the remains of people who have died.
Package take-out foods and/or serve food to customers.
Package take-out foods or serve food to customers.
Participate in fire drills and demonstrations of fire fighting techniques.
Participate in patient care tasks, such as assisting with passing food trays and feeding residents, and bathing residents on bed rest.
Patrol or monitor recreational areas such as trails, slopes, and swimming areas, on foot, in vehicles, or from towers.
Perform administrative duties such as hall and cafeteria monitoring, and bus loading and unloading.
Perform sales floor work such as greeting and assisting customers, stocking shelves, and taking inventory.
Perform serving, cleaning, and stocking duties in establishments such as cafeterias or dining rooms in order to facilitate customer service.
Perform simple extractions to remove blackheads.
Perform some food preparation or service tasks such as cooking, clearing tables, and serving food and drinks when necessary.
Perform team-support duties such as running errands, maintaining equipment, and stocking supplies.
Perform traffic control duties such as setting up barricades and temporary signs, placing bags on parking meters to limit their use, or directing traffic.
Perform work activities of subordinates, such as cleaning and organizing shelves and displays and selling merchandise.
Pick up and deliver items, or run errands for guests.
Pick up and return items for laundry and valet service.
Place or hoist children into baths or pools.
Place patients on stretchers and load stretchers into ambulances, usually with assistance from other attendants.
Place patients on stretchers, and load stretchers into ambulances, usually with assistance from other attendants.
Plan, purchase, prepare, and serve meals to patients and other family members, according to prescribed diets.
Plan, purchase, prepare, or serve meals to patients or other family members, according to prescribed diets.
Portion and wrap the food, or place it directly on plates for service to patrons.
Portion, arrange, and garnish food, and serve food to waiters or patrons.
Prepare and position patients for testing.
Prepare and serve a variety of beverages such as coffee, tea, and soft drinks.
Prepare and serve cold drinks, or frozen milk drinks or desserts, using drink-dispensing, milkshake, or frozen custard machines.
Prepare hot, cold, and mixed drinks for patrons, and chill bottles of wine.
Prepare patient for exam by explaining procedure, transferring patient to ultrasound table, scrubbing skin and applying gel, and positioning patient properly.
Prepare patient for exam by explaining procedure, transferring them to ultrasound table, scrubbing skin and applying gel, and positioning them properly.
Prepare rooms for meetings, and arrange decorations, media equipment, and furniture for social or business functions.
Provide assistance in dressing or changing seriously ill or injured patients or patients with disabilities.
Provide assistance in dressing or changing seriously ill, injured, or disabled patients.
Provide assistance or direction to other stockroom, warehouse, or storage yard workers.
Provide assistance to more skilled workers involved in the adjustment, maintenance, part replacement, and repair of tools, equipment, and machines.
Provide assistance to patrons entering or exiting amusement rides, boats, or ski lifts, or mounting or dismounting animals.
Provide assistance to staff members by performing activities such as inspecting rooms, setting tables and doing laundry.
Provide assistance to workers engaged in construction or extraction activities, using hand tools and equipment.
Provide assistance to workers engaged in construction or extraction activities, using hand tools or other equipment.
Provide assistance with euthanasia of animals and disposal of corpses.
Provide assistance with euthanasia of animals or disposal of corpses.
Provide assistance with patrons' special needs, such as helping those with wheelchairs.
Provide caterers with assistance in food preparation or service.

Provide medical treatment and personal care to patients in private home settings, such as cooking, keeping rooms orderly, seeing that patients are comfortable and in good spirits, and instructing family members in simple nursing tasks.
Provide mentally impaired or emotionally disturbed patients with routine physical, emotional, psychological or rehabilitation care under the direction of nursing and medical staff.
Provide nursing, psychiatric and personal care to mentally ill, emotionally disturbed or mentally retarded patients.
Provide patients with assistance in bathing, dressing, and grooming, demonstrating these skills as necessary.
Provide patients with help moving in and out of beds, baths, wheelchairs or automobiles, and with dressing and grooming.
Provide skin care and nail treatments.
Provide towels and sheets to clients in public baths, steam rooms, and restrooms.
Read food order slips or receive verbal instructions as to food required by patron, and prepare and cook food according to instructions.
Rent, sell, or issue sporting equipment and supplies such as bowling shoes, golf balls, swimming suits, and beach chairs.
Restrain or aid patients as necessary to prevent injury.
Restrain or shackle violent patients.
Schedule and receive food and beverage deliveries, checking delivery contents in order to verify product quality and quantity.
Search prisoners and vehicles and conduct shakedowns of cells for valuables and contraband, such as weapons or drugs.
Select, train and supervise workers who plan, prepare and serve meals.
Sell and serve refreshments to customers.
Serve customers in eating places that specialize in fast service and inexpensive carry-out food.
Serve food and beverages to guests at banquets or other social functions.
Serve food and/or beverages to patrons; prepare and serve specialty dishes at tables as required.
Serve food or beverages to patrons, and prepare or serve specialty dishes at tables as required.
Serve food to customers when waiters and waitresses need assistance.
Serve food, beverages, or desserts to customers in such settings as take-out counters of restaurants or lunchrooms, business or industrial establishments, hotel rooms, and cars.
Serve ice water, coffee, rolls, and butter to patrons.
Serve meals and distribute commissary items to prisoners.
Serve meals, and feed patients needing assistance or persuasion.
Serve orders to customers at windows, counters, or tables.
Serve snacks or food items to customers seated at the bar.
Serve wine, and bottled or draft beer.
Shape and trim beards and moustaches, using scissors.
Shape eyebrows and remove facial hair, using depilatory cream, tweezers, electrolysis or wax.
Shave, trim and shape beards and moustaches.
Show patients to examination rooms and prepare them for the physician.
Signal or instruct other workers to weigh, move, or check products.
Signal or verbally direct workers engaged in hoisting and moving loads, in order to ensure safety of workers and materials.
Signal truck driver to position truck to facilitate pouring concrete, and move chute to direct concrete on forms.
Supervise and check the assembly of regular and special diet trays and the delivery of food trolleys to hospital patients.
Supervise and perform searches of inmates and their quarters to locate contraband items.
Supervise and provide security for offenders performing tasks such as construction, maintenance, laundry, food service, and other industrial or agricultural operations.
Supervise or perform searches of inmates or their quarters to locate contraband items.
Supervise or provide security for offenders performing tasks, such as construction, maintenance, laundry, food service, or other industrial or agricultural operations.
Take animals into treatment areas, and assist with physical examinations by performing such duties as obtaining temperature, pulse, and respiration data.
Take food and drink orders and receive payment from customers.
Take orders from customers and cook foods requiring short preparation times, according to customer requirements.
Take prisoners into custody and escort to locations within and outside of facility, such as visiting room, courtroom, or airport.
Ticket, arrange and display merchandise to promote sales.
Tint eyelashes and eyebrows.
Train or supervise others in laying pipe.
Train workers in tasks such as transplanting or pruning trees or shrubs, finishing cement, using equipment, or caring for turf.
Train workers in techniques such as planting, harvesting, weeding, or insect identification and in the use of safety measures.
Transport and accompany clients to shopping area and to appointments, using automobile.
Transport clients to locations outside the home, such as to physicians' offices or on outings, using a motor vehicle.
Transport packages to customers' vehicles.
Transport patients to and from the occupational therapy work area.
Transport patients to and from treatment areas, lifting and transferring them according to positioning requirements.
Transport patients to and from treatment areas, using wheelchairs or providing standing support.
Transport patients to or from exam rooms.
Treat animal illnesses or injuries, following experience or instructions of veterinarians.
Treat patients using tools, such as needles, cups, ear balls, seeds, pellets, or nutritional supplements.
Use complementary aids, such as infrared lamps, wet compresses, ice, and whirlpool baths in order to promote clients' recovery, relaxation and well-being.
Use complementary aids, such as infrared lamps, wet compresses, ice, and whirlpool baths to promote clients' recovery, relaxation, and well-being.
Use weapons, handcuffs, and physical force to maintain discipline and order among prisoners.
